result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E. Wolf III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:31 a.m. Defendant Robert E. Wolf in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirillis speaks to resolution. Michlig statement to recommendations. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig statement to sentencing. Cirilli statement-argues less jail. Court statement.

Court sentence
WHS
3 yrs. POP
1 yr. county jail w/Huber - commence on or before 08/10/14 at 8:00 a.m. 
5 days' credit
Outpatient treatment allowed
AODA assessment and follow-through/driver safety plan
$2,115 fine includes costs/surcharges
3 yr. d.l. revocation
CV/Supervision costs
IID 1 yr.
$50 IID
Appeal Rights

01:37 pm - Defendant Robert E. Wolf in court with attorney Gary S Cirilli.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Cirilli states offered rec'd for a 5th offense - believes one of the charges in Nevada is charged twice - requests adjournment to obtain records from Nevada - Believes Oneida County charge may actually be 4th offense.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert E. Wolf in court with attorney Gary S Cirilli.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:33
  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Information filed- In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea - 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

01:55 pm - Defendant Robert E. Wolf in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Susan J. Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No intoxicants, no taverns. Defendant allowed on Cross Country Bar premises for work only.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

1:23 p.m. Defendant Robert E. Wolf in court. Steven M. Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in receipt of complaint and was previously advised on counsel. Defendant to meet with counsel on Monday. Wolf speaks to bond; employment is bar premises. Court amends bond - Defendant allowed to be on Cross Country tavern premises for work only. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
no intoxicants, in any amount in any location, no taverns

02:08 PM - Defendant Robert E. Wolf in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
